frameDefinitions: Words in this frame describe a relationship in which an Item is expressed through a Text.
A Selector, often an individual in a leadership role, appoints a Official to assume an official Role in an organization (which can be expressed as the Body).
This frame concerns entities conventionally being referred to by particular names.
A Speaker uses a particular linguistic form, a Name to refer to an Entity.
An Agent performs a Response action in consequence of a Trigger event.
A stretch of linguistic discourse or a Text that a Communicator produces has a Topic that it is about.
frameExamples: The act of murder is rampant <t>in</t> the Bible.
Press secretaries <t>accredit</t> journalists to the sessions.
They corresponded frequently and at length, exchanging intimate letters in which he <t>addressed</t> her as Windflower.
I <t>respond</t> to earthquakes by hiding under my desk.
listRoleDefinitions: The written source, body of work, or linguistic utterance in which the <fen>Item</fen> is found/expressed.
The piece of information or expression that is contained within the <fen>Text</fen>.
When the <fen>Item</fen> appears in the <fen>Text</fen>.
The <fen>Selector</fen> is responsible for the appointment of the new official.  Typically, it occurs as the External Argument of verbs.
The <fen>Official</fen> is a person appointed to a recognized position.

Frequently, the <fen>Official</fen> is referred to only by his/her role. However, the <fen>Role</fen> can be expressed separately from the leader, usually as either a secondary predicate or in a PP Complement (headed by <m>as</m>).
The <fen>Function</fen> is the purpose the <fen>Official</fen> will fufill.
A group of individuals who are elected or appointed to perform some function, and to which the <fen>Official</fen> is assigned.
When the designation of the official takes place.
Where the appointment takes place.
<fen>Name</fen> identifies the linguistic expression used to refer to Entities.
The <fen>Entity</fen> is the person the speaker intends to refer to by using a particular name.
The person who uses the <fen>Name</fen>  to refer to the <fen>Entity</fen>.
The entity that is designated by the <fen>Speaker</fen> with the <fen>Name</fen> used.
The linguistic form used by the <fen>Speaker</fen> to refer to the <fen>Entity</fen>.
The point of time or interval when the <fen>Speaker</fen> uses the <fen>Name</fen>.
The means action whereby the <fen>Agent</fen> responds to the Trigger.
A non-agentive entity that is impinged upon by a <fen>Trigger</fen> event to which they respond.
An event that impinges upon the <fen>Agent</fen> or <fen>Responding_entity</fen> and produces a <fen>Response</fen> from it.
The intentional <fen>Agent</fen> that is impinged upon by a <fen>Trigger</fen> event to which they respond.
The point in time when the <fen>Agent</fen> or <fen>Responding_entity</fen> manifests its <fen>Response</fen> to the <fen>Trigger</fen> .
The location in which the <fen>Response</fen> action takes place.
The <fen>Topic</fen> is what a <fen>Text</fen> is about.
A set of propositions that is coherent in being about a <fen>Topic</fen>
The <fen>Communicator</fen> is the person who has produced a <fen>Text</fen> on a <fen>Topic</fen>.
The time at which the <fen>Communicator</fen> produces <fen>Text</fen> on a <fen>Topic</fen>.
listRoleExamples: Under the new program, SCC will accredit organizations <fex>to assess wood flow from certified forests to workshops or factories</fex>.
<fex>The Lord, who was charmed by her beauty,</fex> addressed her as 'than kaadhali!' (My darling) and hence the name.
And that's the reason why we called <fex>him</fex> 'Tom' when his real name was actually John.
A male voice answered the call, and Jones addressed the man as <fex>'Johnny.'</fex>
No one had <fex>ever</fex> called her 'my lady'.
The diocese responded <fex>by taking the property</fex>
How has the modern welfare state responded <fex>to the needs of working class women</fex>, and why?
Once again <fex>the Government</fex> is responding to a crisis with measures that will only harm patients
Israel responded <fex>yesterday</fex> to the killing of 22 people by Palestinian suicide bombers with a helicopter attack

The auto industry has responded <fex>in the U.S., but particularly in Asian and European markets</fex> by manufacturing an entry-level segment of cars that is more appealing, better looking, and safer than in the past.
In his book, <fex>Smithers</fex> discusses cotton production.
